citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of a new type of aerobic, oxalic acid utilizing bacteria, and proposal of Oxalicibacterium flavum gen. nov., sp. nov.

p.s: Oxalicibacterium (o.xa.li.ci.bac.te´ri.um. N.L. n. acidum oxalicum, oxalic acid; Gr. n. bakterion, a small rod; N.L. neut. n. Oxalicibacterium, oxalic acid (-utilizing) rod)
Cells are Gram-negative, non-sporulating, small rods.
Chemoorganoheterotrophic, using a limited number of organic acids.
No autotrophic growth with either H2 or formate as electron donor.
No growth on phenol, sugars, alcohols and C1-compounds.
The G+C content of DNA is 62–64 mol% (Tm method).
Type species of the genus is Oxalicibacterium flavum.
